Symptoms: Bleeding,small wound, small cut on skin
Treatment Overview: Wash and clean the wound with alcoholic wipes and aniseptic cream/solution. Afterwards, cover it with a plaster
Specific treatment:
1. Wash wound with clean water
2. Dry the wound
3. Use alcoholic wipes to clean the wound
4. Apply antiseptic cream/solution on the wound to prevent infection
5. Cover wound with a plaster, gauze, or melolin depending on size/extent of injury (melolin for heavier bleeding)

For plasters (if it is on toe/finger)
Criss-cross around the affected finger.

Symptoms: Blood trickling out of nose
Treatment Overview:
Pinch the bridge of the nose

Lean forward for 10 mins or until the bleeding stops
Specific treatment:
1. Sit down
2. Tilt head forward
3. Breathe through the mouth
4. Pinch soft part of nose for 10 mins
5. Try not to speak, swallow, or cough
6. After 10 minutes, release pinching of nose and check if nosebleed still occurs
7. If bleeding continues, repeat steps 4-6
8. If bleeding still continues, call 995

Symptoms: Bruising, blue green or black skin
Treatment Overview:
Allow casualty to rest

Stretch and massage affected area

Apply ice to injured area and compress
Specific treatment: NA

Symptoms: Blood is present, excessive bleeding, deep cut
Treatment Overview:
Wash wound. Cover it with roller bandage.
Advised to see a doctor
Specific treatment: Steps for pressure roller

Symptoms: Blood is present, excessive bleeding, open wound
Treatment Overview:
Cover it with roller bandage.
Advised to see a doctor
If unconcious, advised to call 995

Symptoms: Blood is present, excessive bleeding, open wound
Treatment Overview:
Cover it with roller bandage.
Advised to see a doctor
If unconcious, advised to call 995

Symptoms: Blood is present, excessive bleeding, open wound
Treatment Overview:
Wash wound. Cover it with roller bandage.
Advised to see a doctor

Symptoms: Blood is present, excessive bleeding, open wound
Treatment Overview:
Wash wound. Cover it with roller bandage.
Advised to see a doctor

Symptoms: Blood is present, excessive bleeding, open wound, body part detached from body
Treatment Overview:
Preserve body part, cover the bleeding with a bandage
Call 995
Specific treatment:
1) Call 995
2) Place body part in plastic bag with ice pack
3) Label the plastic bag with body part name, persons name, date and time
4) Place it in a cold environment till help arrives
5) Cover the bleeding with a bandage
6) Keep affected area above heart level and keep still.

Symptoms: Blood is present, excessive bleeding, open wound, object stuck in wound
Treatment Overview:
Apply pressure to areas around wound 
Call 995
Do not attempt to remove object

Symptoms: Red swollen skin at the burn site
Treatment Overview: Remove stress on the affected area and wash it under cool water. Finally, cover it with a bandage
Specific treatment:
1. Remove constrictors, e.g. watches, at swollen area
2. Cool burnt area under tepid water for 10 min
3. Cover affected area with sterile dressing

Symptoms: Burnt area is reddened,Blisters
waxy and pale burnt area or skin is charred and blackened
Chemicals
Treatment Overview: Ventilate surroundings and wash wound. Remove contaminated objects and seek medical attention immediately.
Specific treatment:
1. Ventilate the area to diffuse any fumes or gases, e.g. opening windows or turning on fans
2. Flush burnt area with water for 20 minutes to remove any traces of chemicals
3. Remove any clothing that came into contact with the chemical
4. Seek medical attention immediately as effects of the chemical may not be apparent

Symptoms: touched an electric circuit/device
Treatment Overview: Call 995. Ensure casualty is not touching any electrical source. Cover entry and exit wounds and ensure casualty does not fall unconscious
Specific treatment:
1. Call 995 immediately
2. Ensure casualty is not in contact with any electrical sources before tpuching them
3. Look for an entry and exit wound and cover them (exit wounds are usaually at the feet)
4. Keep close attention to casualty and ensure he does not fall unconscious while waiting for medical aid.

Symptoms: Swelling and bruising, difficulty in moving the muscle, pain and tenderness in affected area
Treatment Overview: Rest and cool the area using an ice pack and compress. Keep area raised above heart level
Specific treatment:
1. Rest and support injured area.
2. Cool the area by applying an ice pack or cold compress.
3. Apply compression to injured area by surrounding area with a thick layer of soft padding like cotton wool.
4. Raise and support injured part.

Symptoms: Swelling and bruising, difficulty in moving the muscle, pain and tenderness in affected area
Treatment Overview: Rest and cool the area using an ice pack and compress. Keep area raised above heart level
Specific treatment:
1. Rest and support injured area.
2. Cool the area by applying an ice pack or cold compress.
3. Apply compression to injured area by surrounding area with a thick layer of soft padding like cotton wool.
4. Raise and support injured part.

Symptoms: Swelling and bruising, difficulty in moving the muscle, pain and tenderness in affected area
Treatment Overview: Get to a cool area and stretch the affected muscles, drink water or isotonic drinks.
Specific treatment:
1. Rest and support injured area.
2. Stretch the affected area
3. Cool the area by applying an ice pack or cold compress.
4. Apply compression to injured area by surrounding area with a thick layer of soft padding like cotton wool.
5. Raise and support injured part.
6. Drink lots of water to hydrate yourself

Symptoms: Could not move injured area, Swelling and/or bruising around affected joint,Deformity,Pain in the injured area,Loss of function in the injured area
Treatment Overview:
Immobilization using triangular bandages
Go to the hospital
Specific treatment: Secure fractured area with belts strings and bandages so that it does not move too much

Symptoms: Could not move injured area,Severe pain,Swelling and bruising around affected joint,Deformity
Treatment Overview:
Immobilization using triangular bandages
Go to the hospital
Specific treatment: Secure fractured area with belts strings and bandages so that it does not move too much

Symptoms: Shoulder out of place, Swelling and/or bruising around affected joint, Pain in the injured area, Loss of function in the injured area
Treatment Overview:
Immobilization using triangular bandages
Go to the hospital
Specific treatment: Secure fractured area with belts strings and bandages so that it does not move too much

Symptoms: Could not move elbow, swelling and bruising of elbow, pain in the injured area
Treatment Overview:
Immobilization using triangular bandages
Go to the hospital
Specific treatment: Secure fractured area with belts strings and bandages so that it does not move too much

Symptoms: Severe pain,Swelling and bruising around affected joint,could not bear weight on injured area
Treatment Overview:
Immobilization using triangular bandages
Go to the hospital
Specific treatment: Secure fractured area with belts strings and bandages so that it does not move too much

Symptoms: Severe pain,Swelling and bruising around affected joint,could not bear weight on injured area
Treatment Overview:
Immobilization using triangular bandages
Go to the hospital
Specific treatment: Secure fractured area with belts strings and bandages so that it does not move too much

Symptoms: Could not move injured area,Severe pain,Swelling and bruising around affected joint,Deformity, cannot feel feet
Treatment Overview:
Immobilization using triangular bandages
Go to the hospital
Specific treatment: Secure fractured area with belts strings and bandages so that it does not move too much

Symptoms: Inability to move immediately after a fall,Severe pain in your hip or groin,Inability to put weight on your leg on the side of your injured hip,Stiffness bruising and swelling in and around your hip area
Treatment Overview:
Immobilization using triangular bandages
Go to the hospital
Specific treatment: Secure fractured area with belts strings and bandages so that it does not move too much

Symptoms: A laceration in the skin caused by teeth,A contusion at bite area, dog is sterilised
Treatment Overview: Stop bleeding with pressure roller
Specific treatment:
1) Wash wound with saline solution
2) Dry with gauze
3) Use alcohol swab to further clean the wound if needed
4) Apply clean dressing to wound with gauze and roller bandage
5) Seek medical attention

Symptoms: A laceration in the skin caused by teeth,A contusion at bite area, dog is not sterilised
Treatment Overview: Stop bleeding with pressure roller
Specific treatment:
1) Wash wound with saline solution
2) Dry with gauze
3) Use alcohol swab to further clean the wound if needed
4) Apply clean dressing to wound with gauze and roller bandage
5) Seek medical attention

Symptoms: Two puncture wounds,swelling and redness around the wounds,pain at the bite site,difficulty breathing,vomiting and nausea,blurred vision,sweating and salivating,numbness in the face and limbs.
Treatment Overview: Immobilise affected area to prevent spread of venom
Specific treatment:
1) Identify whether it is a venomous or non-venomous bite
2) Lie casualty down with head and shoulder raised
3) Seek medical attention
4) Apply pressure bandage above bite area
5) Immobilise bite area and monitor casualty for breathing difficulty

Symptoms: Puncture wound at sting area,Redness and swelling around sting area,Sharp, burning pain
Treatment Overview: Remove stinger and apply ice to affected area
Specific treatment:
1) If stinger is in the wound, flick it out with the edge of your card
2) Apply ice pack to wound
3) If stinger is in the mouth, give casualty ice to suck to cold water to sip
4) Seek medical attention

Symptoms: Nausea, vomiting or diarrhea,Dizziness or fainting,breathing difficulties,Fever,skin reactions,Dizzieness/fainting,Loss of consciousness
Treatment Overview: Remove stinger and apply ice to affected area
Specific treatment:
1) If stinger is in the wound, flick it out with the edge of your card
2) Apply ice pack to wound
3) If stinger is in the mouth, give casualty ice to suck to cold water to sip
4)  call 995 and seek immediate medical attention

Symptoms: Puncture wound at sting area,itching or rash,pain/soreness around the area of the bite,difficulty breathing,headache,nausea and vomiting,tingling and numbness around the sting,swelling around the sting
Treatment Overview: Elevate, apply ice, and immobilise affected part
Specific treatment:
1) Get casualty to sit or lie down
2) Elevate affected part
3) Apply ice pack for at least 10 minutes
4) Immobilise affected part
5) Monitor vital signs
6) Call emergency help immediately

Symptoms: Burning prickling stinging pain, Red, brown purplish tracks on the skin,Itching,Swelling
Treatment Overview: Apply vinegar / seawater to injury
Specific treatment:
1) Get casualty to sit or lie down
2) Pour vinegar / seawater on affected area
3) Monitor casualty for breathing difficulty
4) Seek medical attention

Symptoms: Stomach pain, nausea, vomiting,Headache,Muscle pain or spasms,Weakness, drowsiness, fainting, confusion,Difficulty breathing
Treatment Overview: Apply vinegar / seawater to injury
Specific treatment:
1) Get casualty to sit or lie down
2) Pour vinegar / seawater on affected area
3) Monitor casualty for breathing difficulty
4) Call 995 and seek medical attention

Symptoms: Unnaturally fast breathing,Dizziness,Fast pulse,Trembling or cramps in the hand or feet
Treatment Overview: Calm down, cup your mouth and re-breathe your own air
Specific treatment:
1. Remove casualty from cause of distress.
2. Reassure and calm casualty down.
3. Let casualty re-breathe his own expired air covering mouth and nose
4. Do not advise casualty to re-breathe her own air from a paper bag as this can cause
more serious problems.

Symptoms: Excessive coughing,Wheezing as casualty breathes in & out,Difficulty in speaking,Distress and anxiety,Blue skin
Treatment Overview: Sit down, keep calm and get a inhaler. Breathe slowly and deeply. If situation does not improve, call 995
Specific treatment:
1. Keep casualty calm by reassuring him/her
2. Get casualty to get blue inhaler
3. Get casualty to breathe slowly and deeply.
4. Sit casualty down in a position most comfortable. (DO NOT lie casualty down)
5. A mild asthma attack should clear within a few minutes. If not, get casualty to take another
dose from inhaler.
6. Call for medical help at 995 if the situation does not improve.

Symptoms: Cannot breathe or experiencing loud difficult breathing,Cannot speak,Inability to cough effectively,Blue or gray color to lips and fingernail beds
Treatment Overview: Heimlich maneuver or Chest trust for pregnant and obese people.
Specific treatment:
Heimlich maneuver:
1. Wrap your arms around the person's waist. 
2. Lean them forward slightly.
3. Position fist 2 fingers above belly button and cover fist with other hand
4. Perform backward trusts in sets of 5
5. Call 995 if situation does not improve

Modified Heimlich (for pregnant/obese people):
1. Wrap your arms around the person's waist. 
2. Lean them forward slightly.
3. Position fist between in area below ribcage above navel and cover fist with other hand
4. Perform backward trusts in sets of 5
5. Call 995 if situation does not improve

Symptoms: Headache, fatigue, confusion, dizziness, sweating with pale clammy skin,Rapid but weak pulse and breathing
Treatment Overview: Drink water and stay in cool shady areas, alleviate legs and monitor vital signs. If condition does not improve, call 995
Specific treatment:
1. Give water/isotonic drink to casualty
2. Bring casualty to cool shady area
3. Monitor vital signs
4. Alleviate legs

Symptoms: Unconciousness, headache, fatigue, confusion, dizziness, pale clammy skin,Rapid but weak pulse and breathing, Not sweating
Treatment Overview:
Call 995
Stay in cool and shady area, pour water and continuously fan body. Monitor vital signs and check for responses periodically while waiting for emergency servies to arrive
Specific treatment: NA

Symptoms: Facial weakness at one side of the face, arms too weak to raise up,Slurred speech
Treatment Overview:
Conduct F.A.S.T. check
Call 995 and monitor vital signs
Specific treatment: NA

Symptoms:
Untreated bleeding, Pale cold skin,Excessive sweating,Rapid, shallow breathing
Grayish-blue skin,Weakness and diziness, Nausea, vomiting, thirst
Treatment Overview:
Treat cause of shock
Lie casualty down
Elevate legs
Loosen any tight clothing
Keep talking to casualty
Monitor vital signs
Specific treatment: NA

Symptoms: Loss of appetite, sore throat,sneezing,cough,vomiting,fever less than 38.8 celsius, runny nose
Treatment Overview: Rest in bed and monitor temperature regularly
Specific treatment: NA

Symptoms: muscle pain,high fever,headache,fatigue,chills
Treatment Overview: Call doctor, rest in bed and monitor body temperature regularly
Specific treatment: NA
